questions.question_text: An organization wants to ensure that incoming emails were sent from a trusted source. Which of the following DNS records is used to verify the source?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This would be A, the TXT record where SPF, DKIM, and DMARC are setup.

Selected Answer: A
TXT (Text) records are used for various purposes in DNS, and they are specifically used to implement email authentication mechanisms like SPF (Sender Policy Framework) and DKIM (DomainKeys Identified Mail). These mechanisms help verify the source of incoming emails and ensure they are sent from trusted sources.

Selected Answer: C
VPC runs on shared infrastructure just like a public cloud. However, a VPC offers a level of isolation between the cloud customers sharing resources. This layer of isolation is achieved through a private IP subnet or a virtual local area network (VLAN).

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the most closely associated with segmenting compute resources within a single cloud account?
Which of the following is the most likely function to be decremented when a tool is used to measure the distance between two locations on the internet?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The TTL field in the IP header is designed to prevent packets from circulating endlessly on a network. Each time a packet passes through a router (a "hop"), the router decrements the TTL value. If the TTL reaches zero, the packet is discarded, and an ICMP "Time Exceeded" message is usually sent back to the source

questions.question_text:
A user's home mesh wireless network is experiencing latency issues. A technician has:

• Performed a speed test.
• Rebooted the devices.
• Performed a site survey.
• Performed a wireless packet capture.

The technician reviews the following information:

//IMG//


The technician notices in the packet capture that frames were retransmitted. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the user's network issue?

choices.C: The devices are incompatible with the mesh network.
choices.A: The SSIDs should not be the same.
choices.B: The network has too much overlap.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A network has too much overlap when multiple devices or access points within the same network are broadcasting on similar or identical wireless channels:
Hence the 3x 11Channels

questions.question_text: A network engineer implements a 192.168.100.0/25 subnet for a building without obtaining sizing requirements. It is later determined that the building will house 700 people. Which of the following subnet masks will most efficiently support that number of people?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Bits----------CIDR----------SubNet Mask-----------IP Addresses
10 /22 255.255.252.0 1024
